title: How do you set up multi-cloud monitoring for security threats?

content:
Cloud monitoring involves resource monitoring across multiple cloud environments, detecting and responding to security threats, and ensuring unified visibility to reduce vulnerability risks. Its importance lies in enhancing the overall security posture, with application scenarios including compliance auditing, intrusion detection, and data protection.

Core components include a data collection module, a central analysis platform, and an automated alert system. The principle is to aggregate cloud logs and metrics, applying AI to analyze abnormal patterns in real time. In practical applications, it can quickly identify malicious activities, support multi-tenant security policies, significantly reduce the probability of data leakage, and improve compliance.

Implementation steps are: assess security requirements; deploy unified monitoring tools such as Grafana integration; configure cross-cloud data sources; define threat detection rules and thresholds; set up automated response processes. Business values include enhanced threat visibility, accelerated response time, and reduced operational risks.
